dear.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Cars are 59% dearer in Britain than in Europe.
dear.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a dear friend or relative is very important to you and you love them a lot
dear.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: His sister was very dear to him.
dear.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
dear.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: used when speaking to someone you love
dear.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: How did the interview go, dear?
dear.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: used when speaking in a friendly way to someone, especially someone who is much younger or much older than you. This use can sometimes sound rather patronizing
dear.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Come along, my dear, take a seat.
dear.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: someone who is kind and helpful
dear.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: Be a dear and make me a coffee.
dear.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: I could never afford a house around here - they’re far too dear.
dear.translation[5].definitions[1].defin: if money is dear, INTEREST RATEs are high and it may be difficult and expensive to get loans from banks
dear.translation[5].definitions[1].examp: At the time, money was dear and credit difficult.
